   22: -module(ssh_connection_SUITE).

   28: 
   29: -export([
   30:          suite/0,
   31:          all/0,
   32:          groups/0,
   33:          init_per_suite/1,
   34:          end_per_suite/1,
   35:          init_per_group/2,
   36:          end_per_group/2,
   37:          init_per_testcase/2,
   38:          end_per_testcase/2
   39:         ]).
   40: 
   41: -export([
   42:          big_cat/1,
   43:          connect_sock_not_passive/1,
   44:          connect_sock_not_tcp/1,

   51:          connect3_invalid_options/1,
   52:          connect3_invalid_timeout_0/1,

   55:          connect4_invalid_two_0/1,
   56:          connect4_invalid_two_1/1,

   58:          connect4_invalid_three/1,

   70:          gracefull_invalid_long_start_no_nl/1,

   72:          gracefull_invalid_version/1,
   73:          kex_error/1,
   74:          interrupted_send/1,
   75:          max_channels_option/1,
   76:          no_sensitive_leak/1,
   77:          ptty_alloc/1,
   78:          ptty_alloc_default/1,
   79:          ptty_alloc_pixel/1,
   80:          read_write_loop/1,
   81:          read_write_loop1/2,
   82:          send_after_exit/1,
   83:          simple_eval/1,
   84:          simple_exec/1,
   85:          simple_exec_more_data/1,
   86:          simple_exec_sock/1,
   87:          simple_exec_two_socks/1,
   88:          small_cat/1,
   89:          small_interrupted_send/1,
   90:          start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write/1,
   91:          start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced/1,
   92:          start_shell/1,
   93:          new_shell_dumb_term/1,
   94:          new_shell_xterm_term/1,
   95:          start_shell_pty/1,
   96:          start_shell_exec/1,
   97:          start_shell_exec_direct_fun/1,
   98:          start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error/1,
   99:          start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type/1,
  100:          start_shell_exec_direct_fun2/1,
  101:          start_shell_exec_direct_fun3/1,
  102:          start_shell_exec_direct_fun_more_data/1,
  103:          start_shell_exec_fun/1,
  104:          start_shell_exec_fun2/1,
  105:          start_shell_exec_fun3/1,
  106:          start_shell_sock_daemon_exec/1,
  107:          start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi/1,
  108:          start_shell_sock_exec_fun/1,
  109:          start_subsystem_on_closed_channel/1,
  110:          stop_listener/1,
  111:          ssh_exec_echo/2 % called as an MFA
  112:         ]).
  113: 
  114: -define(EXEC_TIMEOUT, 10000).
  115: 
  116: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  117: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
  118: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  119: 
  120: %% suite() ->
  121: %%     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
  122: 
  123: suite() ->
  124:     [{timetrap,{seconds,40}}].
  125: 
  126: all() ->
  127:     [
  128:      {group, openssh},
  129:      small_interrupted_send,
  130:      interrupted_send,
  131:      exec_erlang_term,
  132:      exec_erlang_term_non_default_shell,
  133:      exec_disabled,
  134:      exec_shell_disabled,
  135:      start_shell,
  136:      new_shell_dumb_term,
  137:      new_shell_xterm_term,
  138:      start_shell_pty,
  139:      start_shell_exec,
  140:      start_shell_exec_fun,
  141:      start_shell_exec_fun2,
  142:      start_shell_exec_fun3,
  143:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun,
  144:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun2,
  145:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun3,
  146:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun_more_data,
  147:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error,
  148:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type,
  149:      start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write,
  150:      start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced,
  151:      start_shell_sock_exec_fun,
  152:      start_shell_sock_daemon_exec,
  153:      start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi,
  154:      encode_decode_pty_opts,
  155:      connect_sock_not_tcp,
  156:      connect2_invalid_options,
  157:      connect_invalid_port,
  158:      connect_invalid_options,
  159:      connect_invalid_timeout_0,
  160:      connect_invalid_timeout_1,
  161:      connect3_invalid_port,
  162:      connect3_invalid_options,
  163:      connect3_invalid_timeout_0,
  164:      connect3_invalid_timeout_1,
  165:      connect3_invalid_both,
  166:      connect4_invalid_two_0,
  167:      connect4_invalid_two_1,
  168:      connect4_invalid_two_2,
  169:      connect4_invalid_three,
  170:      connect_timeout,
  171:      daemon_sock_not_tcp,
  172:      gracefull_invalid_version,
  173:      gracefull_invalid_start,
  174:      gracefull_invalid_long_start,
  175:      gracefull_invalid_long_start_no_nl,
  176:      kex_error,
  177:      stop_listener,
  178:      no_sensitive_leak,
  179:      start_subsystem_on_closed_channel,
  180:      max_channels_option
  181:     ].
  182: groups() ->
  183:     [{openssh, [], payload() ++ ptty() ++ sock()}].
  184: 
  185: payload() ->
  186:     [simple_exec,
  187:      simple_exec_more_data,
  188:      simple_exec_sock,
  189:      simple_exec_two_socks,
  190:      small_cat,
  191:      big_cat,
  192:      send_after_exit].
  193: 
  194: ptty() ->
  195:     [ptty_alloc_default,
  196:      ptty_alloc,
  197:      ptty_alloc_pixel].
  198: 
  199: sock() ->
  200:     [connect_sock_not_passive,
  201:      daemon_sock_not_passive
  202:     ].
  203: 
  204: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  205: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  206:     ?CHECK_CRYPTO(
  207:        [{ptty_supported, ssh_test_lib:ptty_supported()}
  208:         | Config]
  209:       ).
  210: 
  211: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  212:     catch ssh:stop(),
  213:     ok.
  214: 
  215: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  216: init_per_group(openssh, Config) ->
  217:     case ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []) of
  218: 	{error,econnrefused} ->
  219: 	    {skip,"No openssh daemon (econnrefused)"};
  220: 	{ok, Socket} ->
  221: 	    gen_tcp:close(Socket),
  222: 	    ssh_test_lib:openssh_sanity_check(Config)
  223:     end;
  224: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
  225:     Config.
  226: 
  227: end_per_group(_, Config) ->
  228:     Config.
  229: 
  230: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  231: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  232:     %% To make sure we start clean as it is not certain that
  233:     %% end_per_testcase will be run!
  234:     end_per_testcase(any, Config),
  235:     ssh:start(),
  236:     ssh_test_lib:verify_sanity_check(Config).
  237: 
  238: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, _Config) ->
  239:     ssh:stop().
  240: 
  241: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  242: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  243: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  244: simple_exec(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  245:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  246:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef).
  247: 
  248: simple_exec_more_data(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  249:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  250:     %% more data received, SSH window adjust needs to be sent by client
  251:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, 60000).
  252: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  253: simple_exec_sock(_Config) ->
  254:     {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active,false}]),
  255:     {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  256:                                              {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  257:                                              {user_interaction, true}
  258:                                             ]),
  259:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef).
  260: 
  261: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  262: simple_exec_two_socks(_Config) ->
  263:     Parent = self(),
  264:     F = fun() ->
  265:                 spawn_link(
  266:                   fun() ->
  267:                           {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active,false}]),
  268:                           {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  269:                                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  270:                                                                    {user_interaction, true}]),
  271:                           Parent ! {self(),do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef)}
  272:                   end)
  273:         end,
  274:     Pid1 = F(),
  275:     Pid2 = F(),
  276:     receive
  277:         {Pid1,ok} -> ok
  278:     end,
  279:     receive
  280:         {Pid2,ok} -> ok
  281:     end.
  282: 
  283: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  284: connect2_invalid_options(_Config) ->
  285:     {error, invalid_options} = ssh:connect(bogus_socket, {bad, option}).
  286: 
  287: connect3_invalid_port(_Config) ->
  288:     {error, invalid_port} = ssh:connect(bogus_host, noport, [{key, value}]).
  289: 
  290: connect3_invalid_options(_Config) ->
  291:     {error, invalid_options} = ssh:connect(bogus_host, 1337, bad_options).
  292: 
  293: connect3_invalid_timeout_0(_Config) ->
  294:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  295:         ssh:connect(bogus_socket, [{key, value}], short).
  296: 
  297: connect3_invalid_timeout_1(_Config) ->
  298:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  299:         ssh:connect(bogus_socket, [{key, value}], -1).
  300: 
  301: connect3_invalid_both(_Config) ->
  302:     %% The actual reason is implementation dependent.
  303:     {error, _Reason} =
  304:         ssh:connect(bogus, no_list_or_port, no_list_or_timeout).
  305: 
  306: connect_invalid_port(Config) ->
  307:     {Pid, Host, _Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  308: 
  309:     {error, invalid_port} =
  310:         ssh:connect(Host, undefined,
  311:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  312:                      {user, "foo"},
  313:                      {password, "morot"},
  314:                      {user_interaction, false},
  315:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  316:                     infinity),
  317: 
  318:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  319: 
  320: connect_invalid_timeout_0(Config) ->
  321:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  322: 
  323:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  324:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  325:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  326:                      {user, "foo"},
  327:                      {password, "morot"},
  328:                      {user_interaction, false},
  329:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  330:                    longer),
  331: 
  332:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  333: 
  334: connect_invalid_timeout_1(Config) ->
  335:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  336: 
  337:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  338:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  339:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  340:                      {user, "foo"},
  341:                      {password, "morot"},
  342:                      {user_interaction, false},
  343:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  344:                    -1),
  345: 
  346:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  347: 
  348: connect_invalid_options(Config) ->
  349:     {Pid, Host, Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  350: 
  351:     {error, invalid_options} =
  352:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  353:                     {user, "foo"},
  354:                     infinity),
  355: 
  356:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  357: 
  358: %% Two out three arguments incorrect.  Three possibilities.
  359: connect4_invalid_two_0(Config) ->
  360:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  361: 
  362:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  363:     {error, _} =
  364:         ssh:connect(Host, noport,
  365:                     {user, "foo"},
  366:                     infinity),
  367: 
  368:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  369: 
  370: connect4_invalid_two_1(Config) ->
  371:     {Pid, Host, Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  372: 
  373:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  374:     {error, _} =
  375:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  376:                     {user, "foo"},
  377:                     short),
  378: 
  379:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  380: 
  381: connect4_invalid_two_2(Config) ->
  382:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  383: 
  384:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  385:     {error, _} =
  386:         ssh:connect(Host, newport,
  387:                     [{user, "foo"}],
  388:                     -1),
  389: 
  390:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  391: 
  392: %% All three args incorrect
  393: connect4_invalid_three(Config) ->
  394:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  395: 
  396:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  397:     {error, _} =
  398:         ssh:connect(Host, teleport,
  399:                     {user, "foo"},
  400:                     fortnight),
  401: 
  402:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  403: 
  404: daemon_start(Config) ->
  405:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  406:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  407:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  408:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  409: 
  410:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  411:                                              {user_dir, UserDir},
  412:                                              {password, "morot"},
  413:                                              {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
  414:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir}.
  415: 
  416: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  417: connect_sock_not_tcp(_Config) ->
  418:     {ok,Sock} = gen_udp:open(0, []), 
  419:     {error, not_tcp_socket} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  420:                                                  {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  421:                                                  {user_interaction, true}]),
  422:     gen_udp:close(Sock).
  423: 
  424: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  425: connect_timeout(_Config) ->
  426:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, []),
  427:     {ok, {_,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),
  428:     {error,timeout} = ssh:connect(loopback, Port, [{connect_timeout,2000},
  429:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
  430:                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true}]),
  431:     gen_tcp:close(Sl).
  432: 
  433: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  434: daemon_sock_not_tcp(_Config) ->
  435:     {ok,Sock} = gen_udp:open(0, []), 
  436:     {error, not_tcp_socket} = ssh:daemon(Sock),
  437:     gen_udp:close(Sock).
  438: 
  439: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  440: connect_sock_not_passive(_Config) ->
  441:     {ok,Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []), 
  442:     {error, not_passive_mode} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  443:                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  444:                                                    {user_interaction, true}]),
  445:     gen_tcp:close(Sock).
  446: 
  447: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  448: daemon_sock_not_passive(_Config) ->
  449:     {ok,Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []), 
  450:     {error, not_passive_mode} = ssh:daemon(Sock),
  451:     gen_tcp:close(Sock).
  452: 
  453: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  454: small_cat(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  455:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  456:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  457:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  458: 				  "cat", infinity),
  459: 
  460:     Data = <<"I like spaghetti squash">>,
  461:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data),
  462:     ok = ssh_connection:send_eof(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0),
  463: 
  464:     %% receive response to input
  465:     receive
  466: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, Data}} ->
  467: 	    ok
  468:     after 
  469: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  470:     end,
  471: 
  472:     %% receive close messages
  473:     receive
  474: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
  475: 	    ok
  476:     after 
  477: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  478:     end,
  479:     receive
  480: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
  481: 	    ok
  482:     after 
  483: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  484:     end,
  485:     receive
  486: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  487: 	    ok
  488:     after 
  489: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  490:     end.
  491: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  492: big_cat(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  493:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  494: 							     {user_interaction, false}]),
  495:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  496:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  497: 				  "cat", infinity),
  498: 
  499:     %% build 10MB binary
  500:     Data = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:seq(1,2500000)>>,
  501: 
  502:     ct:log("sending ~p byte binary~n",[size(Data)]),
  503:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data, 10000),
  504:     ok = ssh_connection:send_eof(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0),
  505: 
  506:     %% collect echoed data until eof
  507:     case big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0) of
  508: 	{ok, Data} ->
  509: 	    ok;
  510: 	{ok, Other} ->
  511: 	    case size(Data) =:= size(Other) of
  512: 		true ->
  513: 		    ct:log("received and sent data are same"
  514: 			   "size but do not match~n",[]);
  515: 		false ->
  516: 		    ct:log("sent ~p but only received ~p~n",
  517: 			   [size(Data), size(Other)])
  518: 	    end,
  519: 	    ct:fail(receive_data_mismatch);
  520: 	Else ->
  521: 	    ct:fail(Else)
  522:     end,
  523: 
  524:     %% receive close messages (eof already consumed)
  525:     receive
  526: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
  527: 	    ok 
  528:     after 
  529: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  530:     end,
  531:     receive
  532: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  533: 	    ok
  534:     after 
  535: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  536:     end.
  537: 
  538: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  539: send_after_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  540:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  541:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  542:     Data = <<"I like spaghetti squash">>,
  543: 
  544:     %% Shell command "false" will exit immediately
  545:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  546: 				  "false", infinity),
  547:     receive
  548: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
  549: 	    ok
  550:     after 
  551: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  552:     end,
  553:     receive
  554: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, ExitStatus}} when ExitStatus=/=0 ->
  555: 	    ok
  556:     after 
  557: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  558:     end,
  559:     receive
  560: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  561: 	    ok
  562:     after 
  563: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  564:     end,
  565:     case ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data, 2000) of
  566: 	{error, closed} -> ok;
  567: 	ok ->
  568: 	    ct:fail({expected,{error,closed}, {got, ok}});
  569: 	{error, timeout} ->
  570: 	    ct:fail({expected,{error,closed}, {got, {error, timeout}}});
  571: 	Else ->
  572: 	    ct:fail(Else)
  573:     end.
  574: 
  575: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  576: encode_decode_pty_opts(_Config) ->
  577:     Tags =
  578:         [vintr, vquit, verase, vkill, veof, veol, veol2, vstart, vstop, vsusp, vdsusp,
  579:          vreprint, vwerase, vlnext, vflush, vswtch, vstatus, vdiscard, ignpar, parmrk,
  580:          inpck, istrip, inlcr, igncr, icrnl, iuclc, ixon, ixany, ixoff, imaxbel, isig,
  581:          icanon, xcase, echo, echoe, echok, echonl, noflsh, tostop, iexten, echoctl,
  582:          echoke, pendin, opost, olcuc, onlcr, ocrnl, onocr, onlret, cs7, cs8, parenb,
  583:          parodd, tty_op_ispeed, tty_op_ospeed],
  584:     Opts =
  585:         lists:zip(Tags,
  586:                   lists:seq(1, length(Tags))),
  587:     
  588:     case ssh_connection:encode_pty_opts(Opts) of
  589:         Bin when is_binary(Bin) ->
  590:             case ssh_connection:decode_pty_opts(Bin) of
  591:                 Opts ->
  592:                     ok;
  593:                 Other ->
  594:                     ct:log("Expected ~p~nGot ~p~nBin = ~p",[Opts,Other,Bin]),
  595:                     ct:fail("Not the same",[])
  596:             end;
  597:         Other ->
  598:             ct:log("encode -> ~p",[Other]),
  599:             ct:fail("Encode failed",[])
  600:     end.
  601: 
  602: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  603: ptty_alloc_default(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  604:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  605:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  606:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  607:                  true -> success;
  608:                  false -> failure
  609:              end,
  610:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, []),
  611:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  612: 
  613: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  614: ptty_alloc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  615:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  616:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  617:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  618:                  true -> success;
  619:                  false -> failure
  620:              end,
  621:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, 
  622:                                        [{term, os:getenv("TERM", ?DEFAULT_TERMINAL)}, {width, 70}, {height, 20}]),
  623:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  624: 
  625: 
  626: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  627: ptty_alloc_pixel(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  628:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  629:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  630:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  631:                  true -> success;
  632:                  false -> failure
  633:              end,
  634:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, 
  635:                                        [{term, os:getenv("TERM", ?DEFAULT_TERMINAL)}, {pixel_widh, 630}, {pixel_hight, 470}]),
  636:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  637: 
  638: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  639: small_interrupted_send(Config) -> 
  640:     K = 1024,
  641:     M = K*K,
  642:     do_interrupted_send(Config, 10*M, 4*K, {error, closed}).
  643: interrupted_send(Config) ->
  644:     M = 1024*1024,
  645:     do_interrupted_send(Config, 10*M, 4*M, ok).
  646: 
  647: do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize, SenderResult) ->
  648:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  649:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  650:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  651:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  652:     EchoSS_spec = {ssh_echo_server, [EchoSize,[{dbg,true}]]},
  653:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  654: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  655: 					     {password, "morot"},
  656: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n",EchoSS_spec}]}]),
  657:     
  658:     ct:log("~p:~p connect", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  659:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  660: 						      {user, "foo"},
  661: 						      {password, "morot"},
  662: 						      {user_interaction, false},
  663: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  664:     ct:log("~p:~p connected", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  665: 
  666:     %% build big binary
  667:     Data = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:seq(1,SendSize div 4)>>,
  668: 
  669:     %% expect remote end to send us EchoSize back
  670:     <<ExpectedData:EchoSize/binary, _/binary>> = Data,
  671: 
  672:     %% Spawn listener. Otherwise we could get a deadlock due to filled buffers
  673:     Parent = self(),
  674:     ResultPid = spawn(
  675: 		  fun() ->
  676: 			  ct:log("~p:~p open channel",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  677: 			  {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  678: 			  ct:log("~p:~p start subsystem", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  679: 			  case ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "echo_n", infinity) of
  680: 			      success ->
  681: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, ChannelId},
  682: 				  
  683: 				  Result = 
  684: 				      try collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize)
  685: 				      of
  686: 					  ExpectedData -> 
  687: 					      ct:log("~p:~p got expected data",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  688: 					      ok;
  689: 					  Other ->
  690: 					      ct:log("~p:~p unexpected: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  691: 					      {fail,"unexpected result in listener"}
  692: 				      catch
  693: 					  Class:Exception ->
  694: 					      {fail, io_lib:format("Listener exception ~p:~p",[Class,Exception])}
  695: 				      end,
  696: 				  Parent ! {self(), result, Result};
  697: 			      Other ->
  698: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, error, Other}
  699: 			  end
  700: 		  end),
  701:     
  702:     receive
  703: 	{ResultPid, channelId, error, Other} ->
  704: 	    ct:log("~p:~p channelId error ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  705: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  706: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  707: 	    {fail, "ssh_connection:subsystem"};
  708: 
  709: 	{ResultPid, channelId, ChannelId} ->
  710: 	    ct:log("~p:~p ~p going to send ~p bytes", [?MODULE,?LINE,self(),size(Data)]),
  711: 	    SenderPid = spawn(fun() ->
  712: 				      Parent ! {self(),  ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Data, 30000)}
  713: 			      end),
  714: 	    receive
  715: 	    	{ResultPid, result, {fail, Fail}} ->
  716: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Listener failed: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Fail]),
  717: 		    {fail, Fail};
  718: 
  719: 		{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
  720: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Got result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
  721: 		    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  722: 		    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  723: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Check sender", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  724: 		    receive
  725: 			{SenderPid, SenderResult} ->
  726: 			    ct:log("~p:~p {error,closed} - That's what we expect :)",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  727: 			    ok;
  728: 			Msg ->
  729: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Not expected send result: ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  730: 			    {fail, "Not expected msg"}
  731: 		    end;
  732: 
  733: 		{SenderPid, SenderResult} ->
  734: 		    ct:log("~p:~p {error,closed} - That's what we expect, but client channel handler has not reported yet",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  735: 		    receive
  736: 			{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
  737: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Now got the result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
  738: 			    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  739: 			    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  740: 			    ok;
  741: 			Msg ->
  742: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Got an unexpected msg ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  743: 			    {fail, "Un-expected msg"}
  744: 		    end;
  745: 
  746: 		Msg ->
  747: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  748: 		    {fail, "Unexpected msg"}
  749: 	    end
  750:     end.
  751: 
  752: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  753: start_shell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  754:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  755:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  756:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  757:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  758:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  759: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  760: 					     {password, "morot"},
  761: 					     {shell, fun(U, H) -> start_our_shell(U, H) end} ]),
  762: 
  763:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  764: 						      {user, "foo"},
  765: 						      {password, "morot"},
  766: 						      {user_interaction, true},
  767: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  768:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Enter command">>), % No pty alloc by erl client
  769:     test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef),
  770:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  771:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  772: 
  773: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  774: new_shell_dumb_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  775:     new_shell_helper(#{term => "dumb",
  776:                        cmds => ["one_atom_please.\n",
  777:                                 "\^R" % attempt to trigger history search
  778:                                ],
  779:                        exp_output =>
  780:                            [<<"Enter command\r\n">>,
  781:                             <<"1> ">>,
  782:                             <<"one_atom_please.\r\n">>,
  783:                             <<"{simple_eval,one_atom_please}\r\n">>,
  784:                             <<"2> ">>],
  785:                        unexp_output =>
  786:                            [<<"\e[;1;4msearch:\e[0m ">>]},
  787:                     Config).
  788: 
  789: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  790: new_shell_xterm_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  791:     new_shell_helper(#{term => "xterm",
  792:                        cmds => ["one_atom_please.\n",
  793:                                 "\^R" % attempt to trigger history search
  794:                                ],
  795:                        exp_output =>
  796:                            [<<"Enter command\r\n">>,
  797:                             <<"1> ">>,
  798:                             <<"one_atom_please.\r\n\e[1022D\e[1B">>,
  799:                             <<"{simple_eval,one_atom_please}\r\n">>,
  800:                             <<"2> ">>,
  801:                             <<"\e[3D\e[J">>,
  802:                             <<"\e[;1;4msearch:\e[0m ">>,
  803:                             <<"\r\n  one_atom_please.">>]},
  804:                     Config).
  805: 
  806: new_shell_helper(#{term := Term, cmds := Cmds,
  807:                    exp_output := ExpectedOutput} = Settings, Config) ->
  808:     UnexpectedOutput = maps:get(unexp_output, Settings, []),
  809:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  810:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  811:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  812:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  813:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  814: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  815: 					     {password, "morot"},
  816:                                              {subsystems, []},
  817:                                              {keepalive, true},
  818:                                              {nodelay, true},
  819:                                              {shell, fun(U, H) ->
  820:                                                              start_our_shell2(U, H)
  821:                                                      end}
  822:                                             ]),
  823:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  824: 						      {user, "foo"},
  825: 						      {password, "morot"},
  826: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  827:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  828:     success =
  829:         ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId,
  830:                                   [{term, Term}, {hight, 24}, {width,1023}],
  831:                                   infinity),
  832:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId),
  833:     [ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, C) || C <- Cmds],
  834:     GetTuple = fun(Bin) -> {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,0,Bin}} end,
  835:     Msgs = [GetTuple(B) || B <- ExpectedOutput],
  836:     expected = ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result(Msgs),
  837:     UnexpectedMsgs = [GetTuple(C) || C <- UnexpectedOutput],
  838:     flush_msgs(UnexpectedMsgs),
  839: 
  840:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  841:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  842: 
  843: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------

  850: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  851: 					     {password, "morot"},
  852: 					     {shell, fun(U, H) -> start_our_shell(U, H) end} ]),
  853: 
  854:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  855: 						      {user, "foo"},
  856: 						      {password, "morot"},
  857: 						      {user_interaction, true},
  858: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  859:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Enter command\r\n">>, [{pty_opts,[{onlcr,1}]}]), % alloc pty 
  860:     test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef),
  861:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),

  874: 					     {exec, {?MODULE,ssh_exec_echo,[]}} ]),

  877: 						      {user, "foo"},
  878: 						      {password, "morot"},
  879: 						      {user_interaction, true},
  880: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  881:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef),
  882:     test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef,  "testing",  <<"echo testing\r\n">>),
  883:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  884:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).

  971: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  972: start_shell_exec_fun(Config) ->
  973:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd) ->
  974:                                     spawn(fun() ->
  975:                                                   io:format("echo ~s\n", [Cmd])
  976:                                           end)
  977:                             end,
  978:                             "testing", <<"echo testing\n">>, 0,
  979:                             Config).
  980: 
  981: start_shell_exec_fun2(Config) ->
  982:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd, User) ->
  983:                                     spawn(fun() ->
  984:                                                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
  985:                                           end)
  986:                             end,
  987:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing\n">>, 0,
  988:                             Config).
  989: 
  990: start_shell_exec_fun3(Config) ->
  991:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd, User, _PeerAddr) ->
  992:                                     spawn(fun() ->
  993:                                                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
  994:                                           end)
  995:                             end,
  996:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing\n">>, 0,
  997:                             Config).
  998: 
  999: start_shell_exec_direct_fun(Config) ->
 1000:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s~n",[Cmd])} end},
 1001:                             "testing", <<"echo testing\n">>, 0,
 1002:                             Config).
 1003: 
 1004: start_shell_exec_direct_fun2(Config) ->
 1005:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd,User) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s ~s",[User,Cmd])} end},
 1006:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing">>, 0,
 1007:                             Config).
 1008: 
 1009: start_shell_exec_direct_fun3(Config) ->
 1010:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd,User,_PeerAddr) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s ~s",[User,Cmd])} end},
 1011:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing">>, 0,
 1012:                             Config).
 1013: 
 1014: start_shell_exec_direct_fun_more_data(Config) ->
 1015:     N = 60000,
 1016:     ExpectedBin = <<"testing\n">>,
 1017:     ReceiveFun =
 1018:         fun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, _Expect, _ExpectType) ->
 1019:                 receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId,
 1020:                               N * byte_size(ExpectedBin), 0)
 1021:         end,
 1022:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct,
 1023:                              fun(_Cmd) ->
 1024:                                      {ok,
 1025:                                       [io_lib:format("testing~n",[]) ||
 1026:                                           _ <- lists:seq(1, N)]}
 1027:                              end},
 1028:                             "not_relevant", <<"not_used\n">>, 0,
 1029:                             ReceiveFun,
 1030:                             Config).
 1031: 
 1032: start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error(Config) ->
 1033:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(_Cmd) -> {error, {bad}} end},
 1034:                             "testing", <<"**Error** {bad}">>, 1,
 1035:                             Config).
 1036: 
 1037: start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type(Config) ->
 1038:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(_Cmd) -> very_bad end},
 1039:                             "testing", <<"**Error** Bad exec fun in server. Invalid return value: very_bad">>, 1,
 1040:                             Config).
 1041: 
 1042: start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write(Config) ->
 1043:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1044:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1045:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1046:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1047:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1048: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1049: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1050: 					     {exec, {direct,fun read_write_loop/1}}]),
 1051: 
 1052:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1053:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1054:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1055:                                           {user_interaction, true},
 1056:                                           {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1057: 
 1058:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 1059: 
 1060:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, "> ", infinity),
 1061:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"Tiny read/write test\n">>}}),
 1062: 
 1063:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"1> ">>}}),
 1064:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "hej.\n", 5000),
 1065:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,hej}\n">>}}),
 1066: 
 1067:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"2> ">>}}),
 1068:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "quit.\n", 5000),
 1069:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{1,inputs}">>}}),
 1070:     receive
 1071:         {ssh_cm,C,{exit_status,Ch,0}} -> ok
 1072:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1073:     end,
 1074:     receive
 1075:         {ssh_cm,C,{eof,Ch}} -> ok
 1076:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1077:     end,
 1078:     receive
 1079:         {ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}} -> ok
 1080:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1081:     end,
 1082:     receive
 1083:         X -> ct:fail("remaining messages"),
 1084:              ct:log("remaining message: ~p",[X])
 1085:     after 0 -> go_on
 1086:     end,
 1087:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1088: 
 1089: 
 1090: start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced(Config) ->
 1091:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1092:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1093:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1094:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1095:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1096: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1097: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1098: 					     {exec, {direct,fun read_write_loop/1}}]),
 1099: 
 1100:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1101:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1102:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1103:                                           {user_interaction, true},
 1104:                                           {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1105: 
 1106:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 1107: 
 1108:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, "> ", infinity),
 1109:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"Tiny read/write test\n">>}}),
 1110: 
 1111:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"1> ">>}}),
 1112:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "hej.\n", 5000),
 1113:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,hej}\n">>}}),
 1114: 
 1115:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"2> ">>}}),
 1116:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "'Hi ", 5000),
 1117:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "there", 5000),
 1118:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "'", 5000),
 1119:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, ".\n", 5000),
 1120:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,'Hi there'}\n">>}}),
 1121:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"3> ">>}}),
 1122:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "bad_input.\n", 5000),
 1123:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,1,<<"**Error** {bad_input,3}">>}}),
 1124:     receive
 1125:         {ssh_cm,C,{exit_status,Ch,255}} -> ok
 1126:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1127:     end,
 1128:     receive
 1129:         {ssh_cm,C,{eof,Ch}} -> ok
 1130:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1131:     end,
 1132:     receive
 1133:         {ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}} -> ok
 1134:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1135:     end,
 1136:     receive
 1137:         X -> ct:fail("remaining messages"),
 1138:              ct:log("remaining message: ~p",[X])
 1139:     after 0 -> go_on
 1140:     end,
 1141:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1142: 
 1143: 
 1144: 
 1145:     
 1146: %% A tiny read-write loop ended by a 'quit.\n'
 1147: read_write_loop(Prompt) ->
 1148:     io:format("Tiny read/write test~n", []),
 1149:     read_write_loop1(Prompt, 1).
 1150: 
 1151: read_write_loop1(Prompt, N) ->
 1152:     case io:read(lists:concat([N,Prompt])) of
 1153:         {ok, quit} ->
 1154:             {ok, {N-1, inputs}};
 1155:         {ok, bad_input} ->
 1156:             {error, {bad_input,N}};
 1157:         {ok,Inp} ->
 1158:             io:format("~p~n",[simple_eval(Inp)]),
 1159:             read_write_loop1(Prompt, N+1)
 1160:     end.
 1161:     
 1162: simple_eval(Inp) -> {simple_eval,Inp}.
 1163: 
 1164: 
 1165: do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, Config) ->
 1166:     DefaultReceiveFun =
 1167:         fun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Expect, ExpectType) ->
 1168:                 receive
 1169:                     {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, ExpectType, Expect}} ->
 1170:                         ok
 1171:                 after 5000 ->
 1172:                         receive
 1173:                             Other ->
 1174:                                 ct:log("Received other:~n~p~nExpected: ~p~n",
 1175:                                        [Other,
 1176:                                         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,
 1177:                                          {data, ChannelId, ExpectType, Expect}}]),
 1178:                                          %% {data, '_ChannelId', ExpectType, Expect}}]),
 1179:                                 ct:fail("Unexpected response")
 1180:                         after 0 ->
 1181:                                 ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1182:                         end
 1183:                 end
 1184:         end,
 1185:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, DefaultReceiveFun, Config).
 1186: 
 1187: do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, ReceiveFun, Config) ->
 1188:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1189:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1190:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1191:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1192:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1193: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1194: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1195: 					     {exec, Fun}]),
 1196: 
 1197:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1198: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1199: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1200: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1201: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1202: 
 1203:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1204:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Command, infinity),
 1205:     ReceiveFun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Expect, ExpectType),
 1206:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1207:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1208: 
 1209: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1210: start_shell_sock_exec_fun(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1211:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1212:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1213:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1214:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1215:     {Pid, HostD, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1216:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
 1217:                                               {password, "morot"},
 1218:                                               {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1219:     Host = ssh_test_lib:ntoa(ssh_test_lib:mangle_connect_address(HostD)),
 1220: 
 1221:     {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, [{active,false}]),
 1222:     {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1223:                                             {save_accepted_host, false},
 1224: 					    {user, "foo"},
 1225: 					    {password, "morot"},
 1226: 					    {user_interaction, true},
 1227: 					    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1228: 
 1229:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1230: 
 1231:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1232: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1233: 
 1234:     receive
 1235: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1236: 	    ok
 1237:     after 5000 ->
 1238: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1239:     end,
 1240: 
 1241:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1242:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1243: 
 1244: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1245: start_shell_sock_daemon_exec(Config) ->
 1246:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1247:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1248:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1249:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1250: 
 1251:     %% Listening tcp socket at the client side
 1252:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 1253:     {ok,{_IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),	% _IP is likely to be {0,0,0,0}. Win don't like...
 1254: 
 1255:     %% A server tcp-contects to the listening socket and starts an ssh daemon
 1256:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1257: 		       {ok,Ss} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Port, [{active,false}]),
 1258: 		       {ok, _Pid} = ssh:daemon(Ss, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1259: 						    {user_dir, UserDir},
 1260: 						    {password, "morot"},
 1261: 						    {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}])
 1262: 	       end),
 1263: 
 1264:     %% The client accepts the tcp connection from the server and ssh-connects to it
 1265:     {ok,Sc} = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1266:     {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sc, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1267:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1268: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1269: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1270: 					  {user_interaction, true},
 1271: 					  {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1272: 
 1273:     %% And runs some commands
 1274:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1275: 
 1276:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1277: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1278: 
 1279:     receive
 1280: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1281: 	    ok
 1282:     after 5000 ->
 1283: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1284:     end,
 1285: 
 1286:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
 1287: 
 1288: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1289: start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi(Config) ->
 1290:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1291:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1292:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1293:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1294: 
 1295:     NumConcurent = 5,
 1296: 
 1297:     %% Listening tcp socket at the client side
 1298:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 1299:     {ok,{_IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),	% _IP is likely to be {0,0,0,0}. Win don't like...
 1300: 
 1301:     DaemonOpts = [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1302:                   {user_dir, UserDir},
 1303:                   {password, "morot"},
 1304:                   {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}],
 1305: 
 1306:     %% Servers tcp-contects to the listening socket and starts an ssh daemon
 1307:     Pids =
 1308:         [spawn_link(fun() ->
 1309:                             {ok,Ss} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Port, [{active,false}]),
 1310:                             {ok, _Pid} = ssh:daemon(Ss, DaemonOpts)
 1311:                     end)
 1312:          || _ <- lists:seq(1,NumConcurent)],
 1313:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p daemons spawned!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(Pids)]),
 1314: 
 1315:     %% The client accepts the tcp connections from the servers and ssh-connects to it
 1316:     ConnectionRefs =
 1317:         [begin
 1318:              {ok,Sc} = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1319:              {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sc, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1320:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
 1321:                                                    {user, "foo"},
 1322:                                                    {password, "morot"},
 1323:                                                    {user_interaction, true},
 1324:                                                    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1325:              ConnectionRef
 1326:          end || _Pid <- Pids],
 1327:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p connections accepted!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(ConnectionRefs)]),
 1328: 
 1329:     %% And runs some exec commands
 1330:     Parent = self(),
 1331:     ClientPids =
 1332:         lists:map(
 1333:           fun(ConnectionRef) ->
 1334:                   spawn_link(
 1335:                     fun() ->
 1336:                             {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1337:                             success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "testing", infinity),
 1338:                             ct:log("~p:~p: exec on connection ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,ConnectionRef]),
 1339:                             receive
 1340:                                 {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1341:                                     Parent ! {answer_received,self()},
 1342:                                     ct:log("~p:~p: received result on connection ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,ConnectionRef])
 1343:                             after 5000 ->
 1344:                                     ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1345:                             end
 1346:                     end)
 1347:           end, ConnectionRefs),
 1348:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p clients spawned!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(ClientPids)]),
 1349: 
 1350:     lists:foreach(fun(P) ->
 1351:                           receive
 1352:                               {answer_received,P} -> ok
 1353:                           end
 1354:                   end, ClientPids),
 1355:     ct:log("~p:~p: All answers received!", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
 1356: 
 1357:     lists:foreach(fun ssh:close/1, ConnectionRefs).
 1358: 
 1359: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1360: gracefull_invalid_version(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1361:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1362:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1363:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1364:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1365:     
 1366:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1367:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1368:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1369: 
 1370:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1371:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S,  ["SSH-8.-1","\r\n"]),
 1372:     receive
 1373: 	Verstring ->
 1374: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1375: 	    receive
 1376: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 1377: 		    ok
 1378: 	    end
 1379:     after 
 1380: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1381:     end.
 1382: 
 1383: gracefull_invalid_start(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1384:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1385:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1386:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1387:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1388:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1389:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1390:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1391: 
 1392:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1393:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S,  ["foobar","\r\n"]),
 1394:     receive
 1395: 	Verstring ->
 1396: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1397: 	    receive
 1398: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 1399: 		    ok
 1400: 	    end
 1401:     after 
 1402: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1403:     end.
 1404: 
 1405: gracefull_invalid_long_start(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1406:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1407:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1408:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1409:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1410:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1411:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1412:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1413:

 1415:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S, [lists:duplicate(257, $a), "\r\n"]),
 1416:     receive
 1417: 	Verstring ->
 1418: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),

 1431:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1432:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1433:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1434:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1435:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1436: 
 1437:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1438:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S, [lists:duplicate(257, $a), "\r\n"]),
 1439:     receive
 1440: 	Verstring ->
 1441: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1442: 	    receive
 1443: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->

 1445: 	    end
