 1449: 
 1450: kex_error(Config) ->
 1451:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1452:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1453:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1454:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1455:     [Kex1,Kex2|_] = proplists:get_value(kex, ssh:default_algorithms()),
 1456:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1457:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
 1458:                                               {password, "morot"},
 1459:                                               {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex1]}]}
 1460:                                              ]),
 1461:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1462:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(kex_error,
 1463:                            fun(#{msg:={report,#{format:=Fmt,args:=As,label:={error_logger,_}}}}, Pid) ->
 1464:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1465:                                    Pid ! {Ref, lists:flatten(io_lib:format(Fmt,As))};
 1466:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1467:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1468:                                    ok % Other msg
 1469:                            end,
 1470:                            self()),
 1471:     try
 1472:         ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1473:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1474:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1475:                                           {user_interaction, false},
 1476:                                           {user_dir, UserDir},
 1477:                                           {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex2]}]}
 1478:                                          ])
 1479:     of
 1480:         _ ->
 1481:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1482:             ct:fail("expected failure", [])
 1483:     catch
 1484:         error:{badmatch,{error,"Key exchange failed"}} ->
 1485:             %% ok
 1486:             receive
 1487:                 {Ref, ErrMsgTxt} ->
 1488:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1489:                     ct:log("ErrMsgTxt = ~n~s", [ErrMsgTxt]),
 1490:                     Lines = lists:map(fun string:trim/1, string:tokens(ErrMsgTxt, "\n")),
 1491:                     OK = (lists:all(fun(S) -> lists:member(S,Lines) end,
 1492:                                     ["Disconnects with code = 3 [RFC4253 11.1]: Key exchange failed",
 1493:                                      "Details:",
 1494:                                      "No common key exchange algorithm,",
 1495:                                      "we have:",
 1496:                                      "peer have:"]) andalso
 1497:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex1)) =/= nomatch andalso
 1498:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex2)) =/= nomatch),
 1499:                     case OK of
 1500:                         true ->
 1501:                             ok;
 1502:                         false ->
 1503:                             ct:fail("unexpected error text msg", [])
 1504:                     end
 1505:             after 20000 ->
 1506:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1507:                     ct:fail("timeout", [])
 1508:             end;
 1509: 
 1510:         error:{badmatch,{error,_}} ->
 1511:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1512:             ct:fail("unexpected error msg", [])
 1513:     end.
 1514: 
 1515: stop_listener(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1516:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1517:     %% to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1518:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey),
 1519:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1520:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1521: 
 1522:     {Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1523: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1524: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1525: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1526: 
 1527:     ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port,
 1528:                                           [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1529:                                            {user, "foo"},
 1530:                                            {password, "morot"},
 1531:                                            {user_interaction, false},
 1532:                                            {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1533:     {ok, ChannelId0} =
 1534:         ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef0, infinity),
 1535: 
 1536:     ssh:stop_listener(Host, Port),
 1537: 
 1538:     {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1539:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1540:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1541: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1542: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1543: 					  {user_interaction, true},
 1544: 					  {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1545:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef0, ChannelId0,
 1546: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1547:     receive
 1548: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef0,
 1549:          {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1550: 	    ok
 1551:     after 5000 ->
 1552: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1553:     end,
 1554: 
 1555:     case ssh_test_lib:daemon(Port, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1556:                                     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1557:                                     {password, "potatis"},
 1558:                                     {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]) of
 1559: 	{Pid1, Host, Port} ->
 1560: 	    ConnectionRef1 =
 1561:                 ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1562:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1563:                                                   {password, "potatis"},
 1564:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1565:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1566: 	    {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1567:                                                   {save_accepted_host, false},
 1568:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1569:                                                   {password, "morot"},
 1570:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1571:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1572: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1573: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef1),
 1574: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1575: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid1);
 1576: 	Error ->
 1577: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1578: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1579: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, Error})
 1580:     end.
 1581: 
 1582: no_sensitive_leak(Config) ->
 1583:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1584:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1585:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1586:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1587: 
 1588:     %% Save old, and set new log level:
 1589:     #{level := Level} = logger:get_primary_config(),
 1590:     logger:set_primary_config(level, info),
 1591:     %% Define a collect fun:
 1592:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1593:     Collect = 
 1594:         fun G(N,Nf,Nt) ->
 1595:                 receive
 1596:                     {Ref, false, _} ->
 1597:                         G(N+1, Nf+1, Nt);
 1598:                     {Ref, true, R} ->
 1599:                         ct:log("Report leaked:~n~p", [R]),
 1600:                         G(N+1, Nf, Nt+1)
 1601:                 after 100 ->
 1602:                         {N, Nf, Nt}
 1603:                 end
 1604:         end,
 1605:  
 1606:     %% Install the test handler:
 1607:     Hname = no_sensitive_leak,
 1608:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(Hname,
 1609:                            fun(#{msg := {report,#{report := Rep}}}, Pid) ->
 1610:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1611:                                    Pid ! {Ref,ssh_log_h:sensitive_in_opt(Rep),Rep};
 1612:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1613:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1614:                                    ok
 1615:                            end,
 1616:                            self()),
 1617: 
 1618:     {_Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1619: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1620: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1621: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1622: 
 1623:     _ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1624: 						       {user, "foo"},
 1625: 						       {password, "morot"},
 1626: 						       {user_interaction, true},
 1627: 						       {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1628:     %% Kill acceptor to make it restart:
 1629:     [true|_] =
 1630:         [exit(Pacc,kill) || {{ssh_system_sup,_},P1,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(sshd_sup),
 1631:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},P2,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P1),
 1632:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},Pacc,worker,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P2)],
 1633:     
 1634:     %% Remove the test handler and reset the logger level:
 1635:     timer:sleep(500),
 1636:     logger:remove_handler(Hname),
 1637:     logger:set_primary_config(Level),
 1638: 
 1639:     case Collect(0, 0, 0) of
 1640:         {0, 0,   0} -> ct:fail("Logging failed, line = ~p", [?LINE]);
 1641:         {_, _,   0} -> ok;
 1642:         {_, _, Nt0} -> ct:fail("Leak in ~p cases!", [Nt0])
 1643:     end.
 1644:     
 1645: start_subsystem_on_closed_channel(Config) ->
 1646:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1647:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1648:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1649:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1650:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1651: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1652: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1653: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}]),
 1654: 
 1655:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1656: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1657: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1658: 						      {user_interaction, false},
 1659: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1660: 
 1661: 
 1662:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1663:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1),
 1664:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, []),
 1665:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", 5000),
 1666:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 1667:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1668: 
 1669:     %% Test that there could be a gap between close and an operation (Bugfix OTP-14939):
 1670:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1671:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2),
 1672:     timer:sleep(2000),
 1673:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, []),
 1674:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "echo_n", 5000),
 1675:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 1676:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1677: 
 1678:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1679:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1680: 
 1681: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1682: max_channels_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1683:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1684:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1685:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1686:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1687:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1688: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1689: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1690: 					     {max_channels, 3},
 1691: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}
 1692: 					    ]),
 1693: 
 1694:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1695: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1696: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1697: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1698: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1699: 
 1700:     %% Allocate a number of ChannelId:s to play with. (This operation is not
 1701:     %% counted by the max_channel option).
 1702:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1703:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1704:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1705:     {ok, ChannelId3} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1706:     {ok, ChannelId4} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1707:     {ok, ChannelId5} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1708:     {ok, ChannelId6} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1709:     {ok, _ChannelId7} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1710: 
 1711:     %% Now start to open the channels (this is counted my max_channels) to check that
 1712:     %% it gives a failure at right place
 1713: 
 1714:     %%%---- Channel 1(3): shell
 1715:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId0),
 1716:     receive
 1717: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"Eshell",_/binary>>}} ->
 1718: 	    ok
 1719:     after 5000 ->
 1720: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 1721:     end,
 1722: 
 1723:     %%%---- Channel 2(3): subsystem "echo_n"
 1724:     success = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", infinity),
 1725: 
 1726:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): exec. This closes itself.
 1727:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", infinity),
 1728:     receive
 1729: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId2, 0, <<"testing1",_/binary>>}} ->
 1730: 	    ok
 1731:     after 5000 ->
 1732: 	    ct:fail("Exec #1 Timeout")
 1733:     end,
 1734: 
 1735:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): subsystem "echo_n" (Note that ChannelId2 should be closed now)
 1736:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId3, "echo_n", infinity)),
 1737: 
 1738:     %%%---- Channel 4(3) !: exec  This should fail
 1739:     failure = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId4, "testing2.\n", infinity),
 1740: 
 1741:     %%%---- close the shell (Frees one channel)
 1742:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1743:     
 1744:     %%%---- wait for the subsystem to terminate
 1745:     receive
 1746: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef,{closed,ChannelId0}} -> ok
 1747:     after 5000 ->
 1748: 	    ct:log("Timeout waiting for '{ssh_cm,~p,{closed,~p}}'~n"
 1749: 		   "Message queue:~n~p",
 1750: 		   [ConnectionRef,ChannelId0,erlang:process_info(self(),messages)]),
 1751: 	    ct:fail("exit Timeout",[])
 1752:     end,
 1753: 
 1754:     %%---- Try that we can open one channel instead of the closed one
 1755:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId5, "echo_n", infinity)),
 1756: 
 1757:     %%---- But not a fourth one...
 1758:     failure = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId6, "echo_n", infinity),
 1759: 
 1760:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1761:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1762: 
 1763: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1764: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
 1765: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1766: do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef) ->
 1767:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, 1).
 1768: 
 1769: do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, N) ->
 1770:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1771:     Cmd = "yes testing | head -n " ++ integer_to_list(N),
 1772:     ct:log("Cmd to be invoked over SSH shell: ~p", [Cmd]),
 1773:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Cmd, infinity),
 1774:     ExpectedBin = <<"testing\n">>,
 1775:     case N of
 1776:         1 ->
 1777:             %% receive response to input
 1778:             receive
 1779:                 {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, ExpectedBin}} ->
 1780:                     ok
 1781:             after
 1782:                 10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1783:             end;
 1784:         _ ->
 1785:             receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, N * byte_size(ExpectedBin), 0)
 1786:     end,
 1787: 
 1788:     %% receive close messages
 1789:     receive
 1790: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
 1791: 	    ok
 1792:     after
 1793: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1794:     end,
 1795:     receive
 1796: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
 1797: 	    ok
 1798:     after
 1799: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1800:     end,
 1801:     receive
 1802: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
 1803: 	    ok
 1804:     after
 1805: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1806:     end.
 1807: 
 1808: 
 1809: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1810: flush_msgs() ->
 1811:     flush_msgs([]).
 1812: 
 1813: flush_msgs(Unexpected) ->
 1814:     receive
 1815:         M ->
 1816:             case lists:member(M, Unexpected) of
 1817:                 true ->
 1818:                     ct:fail("Unexpected message found:  ~p", [M]);
 1819:                 _ ->
 1820:                     flush_msgs()
 1821:             end
 1822:     after
 1823:         500 -> ok
 1824:     end.
 1825: 
 1826: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1827: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1828:     test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Prohibited.">>, <<"Eshell V">>).
 1829: 
 1830: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, NotExpect) ->
 1831:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1832:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef, ChannelId),
 1833:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 1834:     NotExpSz = size(NotExpect),
 1835:     receive
 1836:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 1, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 1837:             flush_msgs();
 1838: 
 1839:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<NotExpect:NotExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 1840:             ct:fail("Could start disabled shell!");
 1841: 
 1842:         R ->
 1843:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1844:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, '0|1', Expect}} ]),
 1845:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 1846: 
 1847:     after 5000 ->
 1848:             ct:fail("Shell Timeout")
 1849:     end.
 1850: 
 1851: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1852: test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1853:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1854:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "1+2.", infinity),
 1855:     receive
 1856:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ->
 1857:             flush_msgs();
 1858:         R ->
 1859:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1860:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ]),
 1861:             ct:fail("Could exec erlang term although non-erlang shell")
 1862:     after 5000 ->
 1863:             ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1864:     end.
 1865: 
 1866: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1867: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1868:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Eshell V">>).
 1869: 
 1870: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect) ->
 1871:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, []).
 1872: 
 1873: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, PtyOpts) ->
 1874:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1875:     case PtyOpts of
 1876:         [] ->
 1877:             no_alloc;
 1878:         _ ->
 1879:             success = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, PtyOpts)
 1880:     end,
 1881:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId),
 1882: 
 1883:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 1884:     receive
 1885: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 1886: 	    flush_msgs();
 1887: 
 1888:         R ->
 1889:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1890:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}} ]),
 1891:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 1892: 
 1893:     after 5000 ->
 1894: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 1895:     end.
 1896: 
 1897: 
 1898: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1899:     test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, "1+2.", <<"3">>).
 1900: 
 1901: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Exec, Expect) ->
 1902:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1903:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Exec, infinity),
 1904:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 1905:     receive
 1906:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} = R ->
 1907:             ct:log("~p:~p Got expected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,R]);
 1908:         Other ->
 1909:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1910:                    [?MODULE,?LINE, Other, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}} ])
 1911:     after 5000 ->
 1912:             {fail,"Exec Timeout"}
 1913:     end.
 1914: 
 1915: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1916: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId) ->
 1917:     big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, []).
 1918: 
 1919: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Acc) ->
 1920:     receive
 1921: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} ->
 1922: 	    big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, [Data | Acc]);
 1923: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId}} ->
 1924: 	    {ok, iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))}
 1925:     after ?EXEC_TIMEOUT ->
 1926: 	    timeout
 1927:     end.
 1928: 
 1929: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize) ->
 1930:     ct:log("~p:~p Listener ~p running! ConnectionRef=~p, ChannelId=~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,self(),ConnectionRef,ChannelId]),
 1931:     collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [], 0).
 1932: 
 1933: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum) ->
 1934:     TO = 5000,
 1935:     receive
 1936: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} when is_binary(Data) ->
 1937: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p bytes. total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 1938: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,size(Data),Sum+size(Data),EchoSize-Sum]),
 1939: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [Data | Acc], Sum+size(Data));
 1940: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={eof, ChannelId}} ->
 1941: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 1942: 
 1943: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={closed,ChannelId}} ->
 1944: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 1945: 
 1946: 	Msg ->
 1947: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ***** unexpected message *****~n~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
 1948: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 1949: 
 1950:     after TO ->
 1951: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ----- Nothing received for ~p seconds -----~n",[?MODULE,?LINE,TO]),
 1952: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 1953:     end.
 1954: 
 1955: collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize) ->
 1956:     try
 1957: 	iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))
 1958:     of
 1959: 	Bin ->
 1960: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nGot in total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 1961: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,size(Bin),EchoSize,size(Bin)]),
 1962: 	    Bin
 1963:     catch
 1964: 	C:E ->
 1965: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nAcc is strange...~nException=~p:~p~nAcc=~p",
 1966: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,C,E,Acc]),
 1967: 	    {error,{C,E}}
 1968:     end.
 1969: 
 1970: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
 1971: %% This is taken from the ssh example code.
 1972: start_our_shell(_User, _Peer) ->
 1973:     spawn(fun() ->
 1974: 		  io:format("Enter command\n")
 1975: 		  %% Don't actually loop, just exit
 1976:           end).
 1977: 
 1978: start_our_shell2(_User, _Peer) ->
 1979:     spawn(fun() ->
 1980:                   io:format("Enter command\n"),
 1981:                   read_write_loop1("> ", 1)
 1982:           end).
 1983: 
 1984: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd) ->
 1985:     spawn(fun() ->
 1986:                   io:format("echo ~s\n", [Cmd])
 1987:           end).
 1988: 
 1989: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd, User) ->
 1990:     spawn(fun() ->
 1991:                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 1992:           end).
 1993: 
 1994: receive_bytes(_, _, 0, _) ->
 1995:     ct:log("ALL DATA RECEIVED Budget = 0"),
 1996:     ct:log("================================ ExpectBudget = 0 (reception completed)"),
 1997:     ok;
 1998: receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Budget, AccSize) when Budget > 0 ->
 1999:     receive
 2000:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, D}} ->
 2001:             Fmt = "================================ ExpectBudget = "
 2002:                 "~p bytes Received/Total = ~p/~p bytes",
 2003:             Args = [Budget, byte_size(D), AccSize + byte_size(D)],
 2004:             ct:log(Fmt, Args),
 2005:             %% ct:log(Fmt, Args),
 2006:             %% ?DBG_TERM(D),
 2007:             receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 2008:                           Budget - byte_size(D), AccSize + byte_size(D))
 2009:     after
 2010:         10000 ->
 2011:             ct:log("process_info(self(), messages) = ~p",
 2012:                    [process_info(self(), messages)]),
 2013:             ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 2014:     end.
